alert.note: Alert for Northwest Fayette; Northwest Raleigh; Southeast Fayette; Southeast Raleigh (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 4:15PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Raleigh and southern Fayette Counties through 500 PM EDT... At 414 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Oak Hill, or near Babcock State Park, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Beckley, Babcock State Park, Oak Hill, Mount Hope, Bradley, Prosperity, Piney View, Stanaford, Meadow Bridge, Pax, Thurmond, Dorothy and Artie. This includes the following highways... West Virginia Turnpike between mile markers 45 and 60. Interstate 64 in West Virginia near mile marker 137. Route 19 between mile markers 1 and 12. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
